title: Simulation-Based Activity Design for Learning Mathematical Theory Construction

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic mathematical concepts (set theory, functions, proof methods, etc.)
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments. VR simulations delivered via mobile-optimized web-based platforms

learning_goals: Learners can explain the three-stage process (problem definition, conceptual linking, generalization) of constructing theoretical frameworks in mathematical problem-solving contexts.
Learners can propose at least two alternative theoretical models to solve given problems in simulation environments.
Learners can revise their theoretical models based on peer reviews and instructor feedback and validate their logical validity.

resources: Online Whiteboard Tool for Collaborative Learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
